snippet.textDisplay: Am I the only one who likes the Shinobi series more than the Ninja Gaiden series?

snippet.textDisplay: I do, by a large margin.
snippet.textOriginal: I do, by a large margin.

snippet.textDisplay: I prefer Shinobi.
snippet.textOriginal: I prefer Shinobi.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think shinobi is better because it’s hard, but finishable and with well thought mechanics.
Ninja gaiden is just hard because you get spammed by enemies, the gameplay isn’t fun and the mechanics are not really unique.
snippet.textOriginal:
I think shinobi is better because it’s hard, but finishable and with well thought mechanics.

snippet.textDisplay: A ninja on a surfboard killing robots while this music plays... this definitely made Stage 4 a highlight in the game. Shinobi III is my favorite game in the series, it's a greatly entertaining action platformer. I liked how it wasn't too hard, though I remember the last stage giving me some problems.
snippet.textOriginal: A ninja on a surfboard killing robots while this music plays... this definitely made Stage 4 a highlight in the game. Shinobi III is my favorite game in the series, it's a greatly entertaining action platformer. I liked how it wasn't too hard, though I remember the last stage giving me some problems.

snippet.textDisplay: If you like Dust you may consider giving something else a try. A game that was well loved in times past has recently risen from the grave, Dungeon Fighter Online. Not only is the gameplay in this game great, but I think you will find the composers for the game were no slouches either.
snippet.textOriginal: If you like Dust you may consider giving something else a try. A game that was well loved in times past has recently risen from the grave, Dungeon Fighter Online. Not only is the gameplay in this game great, but I think you will find the composers for the game were no slouches either.

snippet.textDisplay: Dust is currently a games for gold title so woo. Free game.
snippet.textOriginal: Dust is currently a games for gold title so woo. Free game.

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky
 What are your thoughts on Alexander Brandon's music Gabe? I don't recall seeing you posting it on Best VGM too much. Also, have you listened to some of Brandon's music that's not made for video games? He has a bandcamp, and you can listen to his albums there. Era's End is my favorite.
snippet.textOriginal:
@SupraDarky
 What are your thoughts on Alexander Brandon's music Gabe? I don't recall seeing you posting it on Best VGM too much. Also, have you listened to some of Brandon's music that's not made for video games? He has a bandcamp, and you can listen to his albums there. Era's End is my favorite.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Yeah, Dust is a very good game. The one gripe I had about it was the art style, but that's just me of course. Other than that the game has really smooth combat and a pretty descent story!
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Yeah, Dust is a very good game. The one gripe I had about it was the art style, but that's just me of course. Other than that the game has really smooth combat and a pretty descent story!

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky You will really like Dust,  It is a great Metroidvania that I think you will enjoy.  The music is really good too done by Alexander Brandon,  Speaking of Metroidvanias, I've been playing Guacamelee and really enjoying it.  I'm almost finished with it too.  I might have to start playing Dust again as I was really enjoying it.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky You will really like Dust,  It is a great Metroidvania that I think you will enjoy.  The music is really good too done by Alexander Brandon,  Speaking of Metroidvanias, I've been playing Guacamelee and really enjoying it.  I'm almost finished with it too.  I might have to start playing Dust again as I was really enjoying it.

snippet.textDisplay: @Eric C. I'm starting to really slow down on Diablo 3's expansion, now I'll start playing Dragon Quest III on the SNES and Dust: An Elysian Tale. Should be fun!
snippet.textOriginal: @Eric C. I'm starting to really slow down on Diablo 3's expansion, now I'll start playing Dragon Quest III on the SNES and Dust: An Elysian Tale. Should be fun!
